channel.title: Installation Issue
channel.description:
Mmk, let me begin with me installing Vista. I installed Vista back 5 months ago I'd say, and I decided to remove it, so I did, and I put Windows XP SP1 which I can't install drivers on, because I don't have the right CD, anyways, I decided to get Media Center Edition, because I thought it might have pre-installed drivers, but it did not, and I was without internet.
So I went to install Ubuntu 7.04, and it didn't work, so I tried Kubuntu 7.04, and it did not work either. So I downloaded Ubuntu and Kubuntu 7.10, and they both still did not work, and when I say do not work I boot into the install CD and when I go to Run or install K/Ubuntu it only begins to install, and then it stops. On 7.04 with the non-graphical boot screen, it does this massive list of errors, which I can't tell you them, because they're going to fast.
But when I do the 7.10 Graphical Boot Screen, the status bar goes back and fourth and then stops at the left side, and does not move. Now, I downloaded Mandriva, deciding it might be an issue with the new updates, or something, but that does not work either. I will also tell you that I did successfully install Ubuntu about 6 or 7 months ago. Then made the switch to Vista. I also must tell you I tried to install Solaris, but I had semi-messed up in a sense that I had successfully installed it but removed the disc to soon, so I installed Windows XP to try and format the drive. That may have caused the issue, I am not certain. I have no idea what to do at this point, it is an issue with the Ethernet Driver that is why I decided to install Linux, but after finding out I cannot use Linux anymore, I have found a bigger issue. I have a Dell Dimension 2350.
I was experiencing DVD reading/burning issues when using Vista before I decided to quit using it. I have a two tray CD/DVD Burner, and the Top tray, the DVD tray was not reading or writing. I have tried both trays and they still do not correctly read the Linux CD, however they did successfully install Windows Xp.
I am very grateful to any help you all can offer me.
[hr] [URL=http://www.mobilephones4free.com/default.aspx?r=926998][IMG]http://img357.imageshack.us/img357/4931/refferalses3.png[/img][/URL] [br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2007, 10:40:27 PM[/size][hr]Sorry to [br][hr][b][i]Bumping topics is against the [URL=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3.0.html]Rules[/URL]![/i][/b][hr][br], but I seriously need help. I have to get it fixed.
[hr] [URL=http://www.mobilephones4free.com/default.aspx?r=926998][IMG]http://img357.imageshack.us/img357/4931/refferalses3.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

From your last post, it is most definitely a CD-Drive problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’ve tried that, only one of the CD’s had an error and it was one of the CD’s from Kubuntu, they had shipped it to me. The rest never had any errors. The root of the problem was I had removed Vista because the 1st disc tray couldn’t read DVD’s or burn them, like it was suposed to. After I installed Xp (which I used the 1st disc tray to install) they worked, but I couldn’t get the drivers. So I decided to put Kubunut back on. And it read the CD and went to the Boot menu, and I chose “Run and install” blahblahblah, It began to boot, but then stopped after 5 or 6 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

When you boot and it gives you the menu select the ‘check cd for errors’ option, it should tell you the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Yes, it has worked before.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

You sure you got the right disk reader?

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

No, that’s not the case, I’ve used different types of DVD’s, and I’ve successfully installed Windows Xp SP1, and Media Center Edition 4 times. I’ve given up and just gone back to Vista, I swear, I think Vista corrupted my computer. Though, I won’t be able to use Linux, I’ll at least have internet. If someone does figure out my problem, I’ll be very grateful, if not I may take my issue to the Ubuntu forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

The CD’s run, but as soon as it begins to boot into Live, it stops after 3 or 4 seconds. and just sits there.

I’m guessing there’s something wrong with you DVD-ROM/CD-ROM. Especially if they’re live CD’s, it seems like it’s not reading them correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

The CD’s run, but as soon as it begins to boot into Live, it stops after 3 or 4 seconds. and just sits there.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So you can’t run the CDs? Because that would definitely be your problem then, it could be configured wrong in your BIOS, or you need a new cdrom or mobo.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

That’s the problem, I can’t run the discs, my computer only loads them to a certain point and stops, I know what the latest stable release is, but I was using the Beta of Ubuntu and Kubuntu (Actually called Gutsy Gibbon, not Dorothy Dollis, My bad). I wouldn’t be posting this in the Linux section if it were an Internet issue, it’s to a point where my abilities aren’t qualified. I have a Broadcom or something I’m not at home at the moment, but when I am, I’ll get the model.

[center][/center]

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The latest version of both kubuntu and ubuntu are 7.04, nicknamed Feisty Fawn. The internet should work on both of them, try to post what kind of network card you have.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:150796”]Also what kind of internet are you trying to use? Ethernet? Wireless? Dial-up?

And for future reference, kubuntu and ubuntu are the same operating system with a few different programs, if one doesn’t have drivers the other won’t either, the same applies to XP and XP media center. And an earlier version isn’t going to have drivers a newer version doesn’t.[/quote]

Sorry, I’m not at home at the moment, I would’ve posted the specs, and more detail about everything. It is Ethernet. Though I did know Kubuntu and Ubuntu were the same, e.g. Feisty Fawn, Dorothy Dollis. I didn’t really think about them both having the same drivers, I really was thinking about how Ubuntu was successful in booting the live CD, but Kubuntu never was, that was the root of the issue. I do have the Driver CD’s for WIndows XP SP1, though the install CD doesn’t recognize the hardware. I assumed Media Center had pre-existing drivers in the OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

And an earlier version isn’t going to have drivers a newer version doesn’t.

Actually, I’ve experienced that with Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Also what kind of internet are you trying to use? Ethernet? Wireless? Dial-up?

And for future reference, kubuntu and ubuntu are the same operating system with a few different programs, if one doesn’t have drivers the other won’t either, the same applies to XP and XP media center. And an earlier version isn’t going to have drivers a newer version doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Nobody can help you further without you telling us at least a few of the errors you’re getting. Use the Pause key to stop the scrolling.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m not ignorant. I know how long they should run. I ordered 3 Ubuntu CD’s and I ran them all, I ordered 3 Kubuntu CD’s and ran them all. I burned a Kubuntu 7.10 disc, and an Ubuntu 7.10 disk, I even burned a Mandriva Linux disk. None of them work. I ran them all night and they stayed at the same point the entire time, it doesn’t even boot into the Live part. I’ve run and installed them before, and they take less than a minute, it’s something Vista has done I’m sure, and I can’t figure it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

That or, how long do you wait for it too load. Remember it’s loading from a CD so it takes longer than loading from a HDD.

Could you give use some computer specs, might help diagnose the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

It’s possible that you’re not burning the CD properly, I guess. Maybe you should try ordering a live CD for Ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

HA HA, I don’t have any internet, that’s the whole reason, and I have tried it as well. Nothing works, and that’s still not the point of my posting this topic in this area, I posted it here because I have an issue installing Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Installation Issue
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Download the drivers for whatever OS you install, they’re on the internet you know…

Read full topic
